description: Pork, apple and sage always work well together and this easy traybake with cider is no exception.
name: Pork with Apple, Sage & Cider Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Pre-heat the oven to 180Â°C. Place the leeks and apples in a large roasting tin. Pour in half of the cider, top with sage leaves, cover with foil and roast for 45 minutes.

Mix the garlic, mustard and oil in a small bowl and rub the pork fillets all over with the mix. When the apples are almost cooked, heat a non-stick pan and sear the pork fillets on all sides, about 2 minutes.
Add the pork to the roasting tin on top of the apples and leeks and pour in the rest of the cider. Roast for 20 minutes, rest for 5 minutes covered in foil then slice and serve.
